intro: Erigeron bellioides, commonly known as the white fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of ray and disk flowers. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows, prairies, and disturbed soils, and it thrives in full sun. Its white to pale blue flowers bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron bellioides is often used in native plant gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
